Package IO

Class ConsoleQuest

java.lang.Object
IO.ConsoleQuest
public class ConsoleQuest extends Object
Provides console-based prompts (questions) to create and populate Route, Coordinates, and Location objects.

Uses the standard input Scanner to read user input and validate it before constructing domain objects.

  • Field Details

    • exit

      public static Exit exit
      A command that, when invoked, terminates the application ("exit"). Used to intercept "exit" user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleQuest

      public ConsoleQuest()

  • Method Details

    • askRoute

      public static Route askRoute(ColectionManager colectionManager, long id)
      Prompts the user to enter data for creating a new or updated Route object.
      • Requests the route's name.
      • Coordinates for the route via askCoordinates().
      • A "to" Location.
      • A distance value (must be >= 1).
      • A "from" Location.
      If id == -1, the method obtains a free ID from ColectionManager.getFreeId().

      If the user types "exit" at any prompt, Exit.execute() is called.

      Parameters:
      colectionManager - the collection manager used to get a free ID if needed
      id - an existing route ID or -1 if a new ID is required
      Returns:
      a newly constructed Route or null if an exception occurs

    • askLocation

      public static Location askLocation()
      Prompts the user to enter information for creating a Location object.
      • X coordinate (float)
      • Y coordinate (long)
      • Name (non-empty string)
      If the user types "exit" at any prompt, Exit.execute() is called.
      Returns:
      a constructed Location or null if an exception occurs

    • askCoordinates

      public static Coordinates askCoordinates()
      Prompts the user to enter information for creating Coordinates.
      • X coordinate (float)
      • Y coordinate (float)
      If the user types "exit", Exit.execute() is invoked.
      Returns:
      a new Coordinates or null on failure
